body_html:
I have seen this happen with PyTorch 0.4.0.
Interestingly, the zero-probability event that was selected happened to be index 0 out of 255, even though there were many other zero-probability indices - so the fact that index zero was chosen may be a clue?
In my case the number of samples (n_samples) was 1, which seems to map to the optimized flavor 'sampleMultinomialOnce()'.
I have not been able to consistently reproduce this so far.

body:
I have seen this happen with PyTorch 0.4.0.
Interestingly, the zero-probability event that was selected happened to be index 0 out of 255, even though there were many other zero-probability indices - so the fact that index zero was chosen may be a clue?
In my case the number of samples (n_samples) was 1, which seems to map to the optimized flavor  'sampleMultinomialOnce()'.
I have not been able to consistently reproduce this so far.
